DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Condition QTcF Prolongation Greater Than 480 msec Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has QTc (Frederica) prolongation > 480 msec.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cardiac Condition QTcF Prolongation Greater Than 480 msec
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's formula is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::480_A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

Property.preferredName: QTcF Prolongation Greater Than Integer::480 Millisecond
Property.preferredDefinition: An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's formula is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::480:A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's formula is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's baseline QTc prolongation greater than grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc using Fredericia's formula (QTcF)) > 470 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc using Fredericia's formula (QTcF) greater than 470 msec obtained from 3 electrocardiograms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have QTc prolongation as confirmed by ECG at screening (Fridericia: QTc greater than 480 milliseconds)?

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
